Jogo bel√≠ssimo, uma maravilha tecnol√≥gica de 2004. Continua atual, com gr√°ficos que sinceramente n√£o podem ser comparados aos mais atuais, mas transpassam a tristeza do futuro sombrio o qual assola a humanidade no universo subsequente aos eventos do primeiro Half-Life.
A distopia gerada pelo colonialismo extrativista Combine cria uma atmosfera interessante e √∫nica, e a trilha sonora melanc√≥lica s√≥ adiciona mais a este detalhado ambiente que consegue ser concomitantemente lindo e triste.
Os personagens s√£o bem feitos e possuem prop√≥sitos bem especificados ao longo da trama. A hist√≥ria segue o rumo da humanidade entre o hiato de Freeman dentre o primeiro jogo e este, ent√£o, caso queira entender os eventos do anterior, recomendo jogar o remake feito por f√£s (com o aval da pr√≥pria Valve) intitulado de Black-Mesa. 
O gameplay est√° al√©m de 2004, tendo um excelente level design, fator no qual muitos jogos atuais (principalmente FPSs single-player) pecam, excetuando-se como grandes expoentes os jogos da Arkane Studios e os da ID Software (tirando W:TNC e W:TYB)
Recomendo a compra dos epis√≥dios, que adicionam em torno de 8 horas de gameplay respectivamente (no mais, eles s√£o o real desfecho de HL2).
Por 4 pila vale muito a pena, jogue IMEDIATAMENTE e entenda por que HL3 √© t√£o almejado.

The masterpiece of all valve games.  Straight forward graphics, physics, and gun action.  The story line is immersive and deep, and has an entire lore in it's own right.  One of my favorite games of all time.  10/10.

A fantastic game with an extremely intriguing world and backstory. This game was made in 2004 and it looks and feels fantastic to play, with amazing physics. If you love a dystopian future look and a rebel story this game is perfect.

If there‚Äôs one thing I enjoyed about this game the most, it would be its uncompromising approach to its way of storytelling. Aside from the first minute, there are no cutscenes, no slow walks with heaps of expository dialogue, none of that stuff. Half Life 2 tells its story organically all around you through gameplay and its world, and I admire that. It‚Äôs incredibly immersive as you get to experience the story firsthand, not through watching short movies that take control away from you. You can actually miss parts where other games might switch to a cutscene for, simply because you might‚Äôve not been looking. It‚Äôs incredibly unique and it‚Äôs an example of how to tell a story in a game right. This is the stuff video games need to do more nowadays. 

Being a successor to one of the most influential FPS games of all time , Half Life, this game (in my opinion) surpasses its predecessor in every way. The gameplay, environments, story, characters, everything has been improved over the previous game. It‚Äôs pacing is on point and almost every single level has something new to offer. Characters are much more lively than they were in the previous game with incredible facial animation, model detail and voice acting. I smiled when I saw the expressions shown on Alyx‚Äôs face when she saves you from the Civil Protection soldiers at the beginning. For a game that released in 2004, it constantly surprised me like this. 

There‚Äôs not much I can say about HL2 that hasn‚Äôt been said already so I‚Äôll cut this short by saying that Half Life 2 stands as a gold standard for video game storytelling that so, so many games today fall short of. The combat is frantic and satisfying with  lots of strategic movement, on the fly thinking and varied and interesting enemies. The soundtrack is scarce but makes a resounding punch whenever it shines through. With a little Reshade for ambient occlusion, the visuals are incredible and have stood the test of time. The sound design is incredible, and the gameplay is much more refined than the original and is always fun to play.

Get this game.

probably one of the best games, ever devised. playing this should be a right of passage, to becoming a true gamer. this game also happens to have aged well, and it is still very entertaining/immersive. 10/10
